Module com.example.project_3_software_methodology
Package com.example.project_3_software_methodology

Class TransactionManagerController

java.lang.Object
com.example.project_3_software_methodology.TransactionManagerController
public class TransactionManagerController extends Object
The TransactionController class handles user input commands from GUI and manages transactions for the AccountDatabase.
Author:
Rohan Parikh & Ganesh Konda

  • Constructor Details

    • TransactionManagerController

      public TransactionManagerController()
      Constructor to initialize the TransactionManager with an AccountDatabase.

    • TransactionManagerController

      public TransactionManagerController(AccountDatabase accountDB)
      Constructor to initialize the TransactionManager with an AccountDatabase.
      Parameters:
      accountDB - The AccountDatabase instance to be used.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Initializes the controller class. This method is automatically called after the FXML file has been loaded. It sets up the AccountDatabase, disables all radio buttons within the campusLocationGroup initially, and sets up listeners for UI components to handle user interactions and input data accordingly.

    • accountTypeGroupListener

      private void accountTypeGroupListener()
      Sets up a listener for the accountTypeGroup toggle group. When a user selects a different account type, this listener updates the accountType variable.

    • accountTypeGroup1Listener

      private void accountTypeGroup1Listener()
      Sets up a listener for the accountTypeGroup1 toggle group. When a user selects a different account type, this listener updates the accountType1 variable.

    • accountTypeGroup2Listener

      private void accountTypeGroup2Listener()
      Sets up a listener for the accountTypeGroup2 toggle group. When a user selects a different account type, this listener updates the accountType2 variable.

    • setCampusLocationGroupEnabled

      private void setCampusLocationGroupEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
      Enables or disables all radio buttons within the campusLocationGroup and clears the selection if they are being disabled.
      Parameters:
      isEnabled - Flag indicating whether the campus location group should be enabled.

    • getCampusCode

      private int getCampusCode(String radioButtonId)
      Retrieves the campus code associated with a given radio button ID.
      Parameters:
      radioButtonId - The ID of the radio button to look up.
      Returns:
      An int representing the campus code, or -1 if the ID does not match a campus.

    • openAccountWarning

      private void openAccountWarning()
      Displays a warning if required fields are not filled in for opening an account.

    • closeAccountWarning

      private void closeAccountWarning()
      Displays a warning if required fields are not filled in for closing an account.

    • deposit_withdrawAccountWarning

      private void deposit_withdrawAccountWarning()
      Displays a warning if required fields are not filled in for depositing or withdrawing from an account.

    • handleOpenAccountButtonClick

      private void handleOpenAccountButtonClick()
      This method is triggered by the "Open Account" button click event. It gathers all necessary data, performs preliminary warnings, and proceeds to open an account. If successful, it will clear the input fields after account creation.

    • openAccount

      private void openAccount(String accountType, String fname, String lname, Date dob, String initialDepositString, int campusCode, boolean isLoyal)
      This method attempts to open a new account with the given parameters. It performs various checks and validations on the data provided before creating the account.
      Parameters:
      accountType - the type of account to be opened
      fname - the first name of the account holder
      lname - the last name of the account holder
      dob - the date of birth of the account holder
      initialDepositString - the initial deposit amount as a string
      campusCode - the campus code for college checking accounts
      isLoyal - loyalty status for savings accounts

    • openCommandOutput

      private void openCommandOutput(Account account, String fname, String lname, String dobString, String accountType, double initialDeposit)
      This method handles the output of openAccount .
      Parameters:
      accountType - the type of account to be opened
      fname - the first name of the account holder
      lname - the last name of the account holder
      dobString - the date of birth of the account holder
      initialDeposit - the initial deposit amount as a string
      account - the account

    • createAccount

      private Account createAccount(String accountType, Profile profile, double initialDeposit, int campusCode, boolean isLoyal)
      Creates an account object based on the type of account to be opened.
      Parameters:
      accountType - the type of account to be created
      profile - the profile of the account holder
      initialDeposit - the initial deposit amount
      campusCode - the campus code for college checking accounts
      isLoyal - loyalty status for savings accounts
      Returns:
      the newly created Account object or null if the account cannot be created

    • handleCloseAccountButtonClick

      private void handleCloseAccountButtonClick()
      Invoked when the "Close Account" button is clicked. It checks for all required inputs and proceeds with account closure if validation passes.

    • canCloseAccount

      private boolean canCloseAccount(Account account)
      Determines if an account is eligible to be closed based on its type.
      Parameters:
      account - The account object to be checked.
      Returns:
      A boolean indicating if the account can be closed.

    • handleClearButtonClick

      private void handleClearButtonClick()
      Clears all input fields and resets selections when the "Clear" button is clicked.

    • disableCampusLocationOptions

      private void disableCampusLocationOptions(boolean disable)
      Enables or disables radio buttons for campus location based on the given parameter.
      Parameters:
      disable - A boolean that if true, disables the campus location radio buttons.

    • parseDate

      private Date parseDate(String dateString)
      Parses the input date string into a Date object.
      Parameters:
      dateString - The input date string in the format "MM/DD/YYYY".
      Returns:
      A Date object representing the parsed date, or null if the format is invalid.

    • isValidDate

      private boolean isValidDate(Date eventDate)
      Validates if the given date of birth is a valid and allowed date.
      Parameters:
      eventDate - The Date object representing the date of birth.
      Returns:
      True if the date is valid, false otherwise.

    • checkUnder24ForCC

      private boolean checkUnder24ForCC(Date dob)
      Checks if the given date of birth is under 24 years old, specifically for College Checking accounts.
      Parameters:
      dob - The Date object representing the date of birth.
      Returns:
      True if the person is under 24 years old, false otherwise.

    • isUnder16

      private boolean isUnder16(int month, int day, int year)
      Checks if the person is under 16 years old based on the given date of birth.
      Parameters:
      month - The month of birth (1 to 12).
      day - The day of birth (1 to 31).
      year - The year of birth.
      Returns:
      True if the person is under 16 years old, false otherwise.

    • isFutureOrTodayDate

      private boolean isFutureOrTodayDate(int month, int day, int year)
      Checks if the given date is today or a future date.
      Parameters:
      month - The month of the date (1 to 12).
      day - The day of the date (1 to 31).
      year - The year of the date.
      Returns:
      True if the date is today or a future date, false otherwise.

    • isUnder24

      private boolean isUnder24(int month, int day, int year)
      Checks if the person is under 24 years old based on the given date of birth.
      Parameters:
      month - The month of birth (1 to 12).
      day - The day of birth (1 to 31).
      year - The year of birth.
      Returns:
      True if the person is under 24 years old, false otherwise.

    • handleWithdrawButtonClick

      private void handleWithdrawButtonClick()
      This method is executed when the "Withdraw" button is clicked. It initiates the withdrawal process.

    • parseWithdrawalAmount

      private double parseWithdrawalAmount(String amountToken) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Parses the withdrawal amount from a string and throws an IllegalArgumentException if the format is invalid.
      Parameters:
      amountToken - The string to be parsed.
      Returns:
      The parsed double value of the withdrawal amount.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the amountToken is not a valid number format.

    • handleWithdrawCommand

      private void handleWithdrawCommand(String firstName, String lastName, Date dob, double withdrawalAmount)
      Handles the withdrawal command by finding the account and attempting to withdraw the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      firstName - The first name of the account holder.
      lastName - The last name of the account holder.
      dob - The date of birth of the account holder.
      withdrawalAmount - The amount to withdraw from the account.

    • executeWithdrawal

      private void executeWithdrawal(Account account, double withdrawalAmount, String firstName, String lastName, String dobString)
      Executes the withdrawal transaction, updating the account balance if successful.
      Parameters:
      account - The account from which funds will be withdrawn.
      withdrawalAmount - The amount of funds to withdraw.
      firstName - The first name of the account holder.
      lastName - The last name of the account holder.

    • handleDepositButtonClick

      private void handleDepositButtonClick()
      This method is executed when the "Deposit" button is clicked. It initiates the deposit process.

    • parseAmount

      private double parseAmount(String amountToken) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Parses the deposit amount from a string and throws an IllegalArgumentException if the format is invalid.
      Parameters:
      amountToken - The string to be parsed into a numerical value.
      Returns:
      The double value representing the deposit amount.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the string does not match a valid numerical format.

    • handleDepositCommand

      private void handleDepositCommand(String firstName, String lastName, Date dob, double depositAmount)
      Handles the deposit command by finding the account associated with the provided profile and depositing the amount.
      Parameters:
      firstName - The first name of the account holder.
      lastName - The last name of the account holder.
      dob - The date of birth of the account holder.
      depositAmount - The amount to be deposited into the account.

    • executeDeposit

      private void executeDeposit(Account account, double depositAmount, String firstName, String lastName, String accountType, String dobString)
      Executes the deposit transaction, updating the account's balance if the transaction is successful.
      Parameters:
      account - The account to which funds will be deposited.
      depositAmount - The amount of funds to deposit.
      firstName - The first name of the account holder.
      lastName - The last name of the account holder.
      accountType - The type of the account.

    • handlePrintButtonClick

      private void handlePrintButtonClick()
      When the "Print" button is clicked, this method is called to print the sorted list of accounts.

    • handlePrintInterestButtonClick

      private void handlePrintInterestButtonClick()
      When the "Print Interest" button is clicked, this method is invoked to print the fees and interests for accounts.

    • handlePrintUpdateButtonClick

      private void handlePrintUpdateButtonClick()
      When the "Print Update" button is clicked, this method is executed to show updated balances for all accounts.

    • importFile

      private void importFile()
      This method is called when a user wants to import account information from a file. It opens a FileChooser dialog for the user to select a file.

    • duplicateOutputText

      private void duplicateOutputText(String text)
      This method is used to duplicate output messages across all output text areas of the UI,
      Parameters:
      text - The message text to be displayed in the output areas.

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String title, String content)
      This method creates and displays an alert dialog with a warning icon.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the alert dialog, which appears in the title bar.
      content - The main content text of the alert, describing the warning or information.
